question: The addition of certain materials called radical inhibitors to halogenation reactions causes the reactions to come to a virtually complete stop. An example is the inhibition by $I_2$ of the chlorination of methane. Explain how this inhibition might come about. (Hint: Calculate $\Delta H^o$ values for possible reactions of the various species present in the system with $I_2$, and evaluate the possible further reactivity of the products of these $I_2$ reactions.)
